The Congo peafowl is listed as near threatened on the IUCN Red List. As of 2013, the wild population was estimated at between 2,500 and 9,000 adult individuals.

The Congo peafowl, also known as the African peafowl or mbulu by the Bakôngo, is a species of peafowl native to the Congo Basin. It is one of three peafowl species and the only member of the subfamily Pavoninae native to Africa. It is listed as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List.  Cp2JVibSCo

Big-headed Turtle is currently protected under domestic legislation in China, Myanmar, Thailand and Vietnam, but further protection is required in range countries such as Lao PDR and Cambodia.

IUCN: 50% of primate species are endangered. One hundred thirty-one of the world's 5491 identified mammals are endangered, threatened, or fragile. Whales, dolphins, and porpoises are disappearing. 594 IUCN-listed reptiles are threatened or endangered.

IUCN says 68% of 300,000 plant species are endangered. 1/3 of 6300 amphibian species are threatened—192 of 9865 bird species are at "very high risk" of extinction. IUCN says 30% of 1.3 million invertebrate species are threatened. In tropical woodlands, 90% of primates live.
